usa: The Truman Doctrine was declared, establishing "the policy of the United States to support free peoples who are resisting attempted subjugation by armed minorities or by outside pressures."<sup id="cite_ref-229" class="reference">[229]</sup>

President Truman signed executive order 9835; establishing the Federal Employee Loyalty Program to search out the "infiltration of disloyal persons" in the U.S. Government.<sup id="cite_ref-230" class="reference">[230]</sup>
Jackie Robinson of the Brooklyn Dodgers broke the color line in Major League Baseball.<sup id="cite_ref-231" class="reference">[231]</sup>
The Marshall Plan was announced by U.S. Secretary of State George Marshall.<sup id="cite_ref-232" class="reference">[232]</sup>
The Taft Hartley Act was enacted, with the House and Senate overriding President Truman's veto of the bill.<sup id="cite_ref-233" class="reference">[233]</sup>
The Roswell UFO incident occurred near Roswell, New Mexico.[234]
The Presidential Succession Act was signed into law.<sup id="cite_ref-235" class="reference">[235]</sup>
The National Security Act of 1947 was signed into law, establishing the Central Intelligence Agency.<sup id="cite_ref-236" class="reference">[236]</sup>
The General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade was signed in Geneva.<sup id="cite_ref-237" class="reference">[237]</sup>
